Subjective: The patient has been constipated for approximately 3 months.
The patient has defecation breaks of 2 to 3 days.
The patient experiences abdominal pain when constipated.
The patient experiences abdominal cramps when constipated.
The patient experiences bloating when constipated.
The patient has no change in appetite.
The patient has a normal eating pattern.
The patient has not recently lost any weight.
The patient does not see blood in their stools.
Request for help: the patient wants advice on how to have softer stools.
Objective: Abdomen: pressure pain in the lower left abdomen.
Abdomen: percussion dullness in the lower left abdomen.
Assessment: The pattern of symptoms is consistent with a constipation variant of irritable bowel syndrome.
Plan: Patient starts with psyllium fibre in sachets.
Psyllium fibre must be taken daily with sufficient water.
Treatment duration with psyllium fibre is 6 weeks.
A follow-up appointment is scheduled in 6 weeks.
Patient should contact us sooner if abdominal pain increases.
Patient should contact us sooner if they develop a fever.
Patient should contact us sooner if there is blood in their stool.
We are considering referring the patient to a dietician at the next consultation.
